location: The same. A hall of state: a banquet prepared.

lines.text: Enter SIMONIDES, THAISA, Lords, Attendants, and Knights, from tilting

lines.speaker: thaisa
lines.text: But you, my knight and guest To whom this wreath of victory I give, And crown you king of this days happiness.

lines.speaker: pericles
lines.text: Tis more by fortune, lady, than by merit.

lines.speaker: simonides
lines.text: Call it by what you will, the day is yours And here, I hope, is none that envies it. In framing an artist, art hath thus decreed, To make some good, but others to exceed And you are her labourd scholar. Come, queen o the feast, For, daughter, so you are,here take your place: Marshal the rest, as they deserve their grace.

lines.speaker: knights
lines.text: We are honourd much by good Simonides.

lines.speaker: simonides
lines.text: Your presence glads our days: honour we love For who hates honour hates the gods above.

lines.speaker: marshal
lines.text: Sir, yonder is your place.

lines.speaker: pericles
lines.text: Some other is more fit.

lines.speaker: first knight
lines.text: Contend not, sir for we are gentlemen That neither in our hearts nor outward eyes Envy the great nor do the low despise.

lines.speaker: pericles
lines.text: You are right courteous knights.

lines.speaker: simonides
lines.text: Sit, sir, sit.

lines.speaker: pericles
lines.text: By Jove, I wonder, that is king of thoughts, These cates resist me, she but thought upon.

lines.speaker: thaisa
lines.text: By Juno, that is queen of marriage, All viands that I eat do seem unsavoury. Wishing him my meat. Sure, hes a gallant gentleman.

lines.speaker: simonides
lines.text: Hes but a country gentleman Has done no more than other knights have done Has broken a staff or so so let it pass.

lines.speaker: thaisa
lines.text: To me he seems like diamond to glass.

lines.speaker: pericles
lines.text: Yon kings to me like to my fathers picture, Which tells me in that glory once he was Had princes sit, like stars, about his throne, And he the sun, for them to reverence None that beheld him, but, like lesser lights, Did vail their crowns to his supremacy: Where now his sons like a glowworm in the night, The which hath fire in darkness, none in light: Whereby I see that Times the king of men, Hes both their parent, and he is their grave, And gives them what he will, not what they crave.

lines.speaker: simonides
lines.text: What, are you merry, knights

lines.speaker: knights
lines.text: Who can be other in this royal presence

lines.speaker: simonides
lines.text: Here, with a cup thats stored unto the brim, As you do love, fill to your mistress lips, We drink this health to you.

lines.speaker: knights
lines.text: We thank your grace.

lines.speaker: simonides
lines.text: Yet pause awhile: Yon knight doth sit too melancholy, As if the entertainment in our court Had not a show might countervail his worth. Note it not you, Thaisa

lines.speaker: thaisa
lines.text: What is it To me, my father

lines.speaker: simonides
lines.text: O, attend, my daughter: Princes in this should live like gods above, Who freely give to every one that comes To honour them: And princes not doin g so are like to gnats, Which make a sound, but killd are wonderd at. Therefore to make his entrance more sweet, Here, say we drink this standingbowl of wine to him.

lines.speaker: thaisa
lines.text: Alas, my father, it befits not me Unto a stranger knight to be so bold: He may my proffer take for an offence, Since men take womens gifts for impudence.

lines.speaker: simonides
lines.text: How! Do as I bid you, or youll move me else.

lines.speaker: thaisa
lines.text: [Aside]  Now, by the gods, he could not please me better.

lines.speaker: simonides
lines.text: And furthermore tell him, we desire to know of him, Of whence he is, his name and parentage.

lines.speaker: thaisa
lines.text: The king my father, sir, has drunk to you.

lines.speaker: pericles
lines.text: I thank him.

lines.speaker: thaisa
lines.text: Wishing it so much blood unto your life.

lines.speaker: pericles
lines.text: I thank both him and you, and pledge him freely.

lines.speaker: thaisa
lines.text: And further he desires to know of you, Of whence you are, your name and parentage.

lines.speaker: pericles
lines.text: A gentleman of Tyre my name, Pericles My education been in arts and arms Who, looking for adventures in the world, Was by the rough seas reft of ships and men, And after shipwreck driven upon this shore.

lines.speaker: thaisa
lines.text: He thanks your grace names himself Pericles, A gentleman of Tyre, Who only by misfortune of the seas Bereft of ships and men, cast on this shore.

lines.speaker: simonides
lines.text: Now, by the gods, I pity his misfortune, And will awake him from his melancholy. Come, gentlemen, we sit too long on trifles, And waste the time, which looks for other revels. Even in your armours, as you are addressd, Will very well become a soldiers dance. I will not have excuse, with saying this Loud music is too harsh for ladies heads, Since they love men in arms as well as beds. So, this was well askd,twas so well performd. Come, sir Here is a lady that wants breathing too: And I have heard, you knights of Tyre Are excellent in making ladies trip And that their measures are as excellent.
The Knights dance

lines.speaker: pericles
lines.text: In those that practise them they are, my lord.

lines.speaker: simonides
lines.text: O, thats as much as you would be denied Of your fair courtesy. Unclasp, unclasp: Thanks, gentlemen, to all all have done well. But you the best. Pages and lights, to conduct These knights unto their several lodgings! Yours, sir, We have given order to be next our own.
The Knights and Ladies dance
To PERICLES
To PERICLES

lines.speaker: pericles
lines.text: I am at your graces pleasure.

lines.speaker: simonides
lines.text: Princes, it is too late to talk of love And thats the mark I know you level at: Therefore each one betake him to his rest Tomorrow all for speeding do their best.
Exeunt
